instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing KB input/EFI Locked
threads.message: So I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> That is EFI Locked.  I tried to perform a PRAM reset but it will not do it. When I plug in an external KB it will respond to me hold option to see the EFI padlock, but any other key combos I get nothing. I hooked and External drive to it and can see usb activity, I also have a couple other <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards that I put in to the case and the KB works. Would it be safe to assume <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> is bad? I checked the pins up close on the KB connector and they appear solid. I just find it weird that even on an external KB it does not respond.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing KB input/EFI Locked
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing KB input/EFI Locked
threads.message: Yeah I tried that procedure. Still would not work. I ended up replacing the IC. It now will let me do a PRAM reset. Customer doesn't care if passwords do not match since it is out of any kind of warranty. I'm assuming either a corrupt BIOS or chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing KB input/EFI Locked
threads.message: I meant serial numbers not passwords.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing KB input/EFI Locked
threads.message:
You can reflash BIOS chip with known good file.
No clean ME region there...
